title: 구글메일 불러오기
content: 법인 기업입니다. 퇴사자의 구글 메일을 백업 후 열람을 위해 썬더버드를 사용하려고 합니다. 개인폴더 > 설정을 통해 '스팸함 및 휴지통을 포함한 모든 메일.mbox' 파일까지 생성되었고, 퇴사자 메일함에 있던 메일 제목까지 확인 가능합니다. 하지만 해당 메일을 눌러도 우측 화면에 내용 전체가 나오질 않습니다. 해결 방법을 알고 싶습니다.

title: Thunderbird Local Email Archive Folder
content:
How do I configure the new "Local Folders" archive set just created - so they'll be displayed and searchable in the Email folder view?

Thunderbird v128.9.0esr (64-bit) on Linux Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS

I have archived emails on my IMAP server for some time.

Now to avoid a full quota on the server I have reconfigured the Archive to "Local Folders" and changed the configuration to yyyy/yyyy-mm.

After archiving "fresh" emails and re-archiving from the IMAP server archive folder

I can see the respective sequences of folders under the menu

  • Account Settings
  • email@account.com
  • Copies & Folders
  • Archives on Local Folder 
and within the file selector menu
  • Archives on Local Folders
  • Local Folders
  • Archives
  • 2023
  • 2023-01
  • 2023-02
  • etc

The result in the email account folder shows the old "Archive" folder - but now emptied - alongside new (unarchived) emails.

On interrogating the Archive folder properties the location reported is the (previous) IMAP address.

So how do I:

  1. identify the location of the newly created "Local Folders" archive set, and
  2. make the Archive folder set display and be searchable in the Email folder view?
creator: mail1619

title: When getting e-mail from a POP3 server, subject is empty and date is default
content:
I have a homegrown POP3 bridge server. It implements the basic commands plus CAPA with TOP and UIDL.

Thunderbird is requesting:

  1. USER
  2. PASS
  3. STAT
  4. LIST
  5. UIDL
  6. NOOP
  7. RETR

Notes:

  1. The response of STAT correctly tells how many e-mails exist but the size announced is dummy and doesn't match the real sum of the size of the e-mails (nor the sum of the sizes output by LIST).
  2. The response of LIST correctly tells how many e-mails exist the size of each one is dummy but different numbers. Each element of a list corresponding to the same e-mail always has the same published size.
  3. If the oldest e-mail is deleted, LIST will shift all values
  4. In the response of UIDL, the uid is unique. Deleting an e-mail won't cause a reuse of the uid.

Thunderbird settings set:

  1. "Fetch headers only" unticked.
  2. "Leave messages on server" ticked and unticked the part of "For most" and "Until I delete them".
  3. Everything else is set to default settings.

Thunderbird user behavior:

  1. Thunderbird is accessing and downloading e-mails.
  2. E-mails listed, are listed with just default variable values (see email_appearance.png)
  3. If I open properties and press repair folder, all messages appear normal as if it's fixed. But it's not because all new e-mail continues having the same issue.
  4. E-mails downloaded open correctly, including attachments, and display all metadata correctly. I.e While in the list the date is the default, in the GUI of the e-mail header, it appears correctly. Same for subject and all other headers that thunderbird displays.
  5. Sometimes, Thunderbird decides to download all e-mail a second time.


Thunderbird unexpected behavior with server:

  1. Sometimes, there is a new e-mail and another e-mails is deleted in the server. Thunderbird requests STAT and then assumes there is no new e-mails even though the size reported changes.
  2. Sometimes, there is a new e-mail. Thunderbird uses command STAT which responds differently from the STAT in the previous session (E.g. 1 more e-mail and higher size) but thunderbird displays in the interface as if there's no new e-mail.
  3. Sometimes, thunderbird executes STAT, then LIST, then decides to download all e-mail, even without executing UIDL command to confirm the e-mail uids. I don't know when that happens.


Examples:

These responses lead to a full re-download of all listed e-mail.: STAT: +OK 14 85539 LIST: +OK 14 messages 1 1910 2 2692 3 8118 4 1101 5 3910 6 8916 7 6456 8 6500 9 6518 10 6602 11 7595 12 9363 13 9369 14 6489 .

UIDL: +OK 14 messages 1 2311910 2 2312692 3 2328118 4 2323011 5 2313910 6 2338916 7 2346456 8 2346500 9 2346518 10 2346602 11 2347595 12 2349363 13 2349369 14 2356489 .


-> Then it downloads all e-mail.

Next connection,

STAT: +OK 15 92559

-> Thunderbird doesn't do anything and doesn't download the new e-mail.


5 connections later, I delete a few e-mails in the server

STAT: +OK 12 72939

LIST: +OK 12 messages 1 1910 2 2692 3 8118 4 1101 5 3910 6 8916 7 6456 8 7595 9 9363 10 6489 11 9369 12 7020 .

UIDL: +OK 12 messages 1 2311910 2 2312692 3 2328118 4 2323011 5 2313910 6 2338916 7 2346456 8 2347595 9 2349363 10 2356489 11 2349369 12 2357020 .


-> Thunderbird downloads (RETR) all e-mails.


Why is thunderbird downloading all e-mails?


Issues in analysis:

  1. Downloaded e-mails appear listed without their subject and date appears as default although all of that data is in the e-mail. Repairing .msf file makes it appear correctly.
  2. Thunderbird is downloading all e-mails every time it contacts the server and it considers there's an update.


Thunderbird version: 128.7.1esr I don't have any antivirus and I'm using an ubuntu 24.04 variant.
creator: brunoais

title: Thunderbird Favorite Folders: Order?
content:
Is there a way to sort Favorite folders? I've tried dragging them to a new order with horrible consequences. Instead of changing the order, the actual folder was moved to a sub-folder position within the actual folder I was trying to move to the position beneath it.

In other words, if I have Favorite folders: A, B, C, E, F, D and I want to move Folder D to the position after C and before E, dragging D to C will cause the physical location of the Folder D to be moved to a sub-folder position of Folder C in the email account.

If you then move it back to it's correct position AND folder D had sub-folders as well, you will then get the error message for any of Folder D's sub-folders: Unable to open the summary file for FOLDER D's SUBFOLDER NAME. Perhaps there was an error on disk, or the full path is too long.

BTW: is there a way to fix that error as well?
creator: SewHelpMe

title: Message pinning -- This really needs to be added
content:
Pinning is not the same thing as tagging. Tagging is great, but the ability to pin messages so they always sort to the top of the list is extremely important to me. Pinned messages serve as reminders or to-do's--important things I always see first--especially in the Inbox when I launch Thunderbird.

Filtering by tags just doesn't get it as it takes extra time and clicks, and out-of-sight is out-of-mind. Pinning is a common thing and I'm sure the developers can do it. It greatly contributes to productivity and with ThunderMail coming I would think productivity would be an important issue.

PALEEEEEEEZ add pinning to Thunderbird!

Thank you!
creator: Robb995

title: Can someone please help me with recovering local folders?
content:
I'm trying to transfer to a new computer. The instructions say to copy your profile folders in imap roaming to a new computer and everything will be there. But the local folders are not there. The instructions also say the data from addons is stored in the profiles folder, but that didn't seem to transfer either. Nor did message filters. Then I saw a post where they said to go up 3 levels from the profiles folder and copy all that. Is that right? But it also says the local folders should be under local/thunderbird instead of roaming/mozilla thunderbird. And I don't see any mailbox folders there.

Also supposedly you are supposed to be able to go to a command window and type thunderbird -P "profile" to open a specific one, but when I do that it doesn't show me the profile names, just default, default-esr, and default-esr1. But I have multiple profiles on my computer so I am unable to choose the different ones.

Seaching through past posts is sometimes not useful because they refer to old versions of TB.

A few more details: I loaded TB fresh on a new computer and ended up with 2 profiles. Not sure why. But I already had 2 profiles on my old computer which contain all the personalization so I'm trying to move. One of the 2 on the old computer contains local folders I've never been able to figure out how to bring back into my current profile, instead of having to go into that profile when I want to look at local folders. (I did that because Thunderbird performance was really suffering with large local folders, but I'm hoping that problem is solved now. What I would like to do is combine all the local folders from the 2 old profiles into one and make that the active one on my new computer. I'm sure there is a way I can move the local message files, I remember doing this many years ago, but the file extensions changed since then and I need to know which ones to move. THANKS!
creator: qofmiwok
